video.title: Quincy Interviews Open Source Legends The Changelog for their 10 Year Anniversary
video.description:
Quincy Larson interviews The Changelog hosts Adam Stacoviak and Jerod Santo as they celebrate 10 years of open source podcasts. Then they interview him for freeCodeCamp's 5 year anniversary. Full Timestamps:

0:00 Quincy's intro
===|freeCodeCamp Interviews The Changelog|===
3:06 interview starts
4:35 Adam's journey from a poor town to the military
9:55 Adam joins the military, climbs in rank, serves overseas
18:00 Adam returns and goes into sales
29:05 Adam gets his first job in tech at a consultancy
34:40 Adam gets into podcasting
37:15 Adam starts The Changelog podcast
49:40 "Podfading" starts and how Jerod stepped in to help
58:31 Jerod's origin story
1:04:56 Jerod gets stranded for 2 years in government agency limbo
1:13:30 "An overnight success that took many years"
1:19:51 The 3 C's
1:22:05 The Changelog "goes pro" and becomes a profitable business
1:36:34 The creation of Go Time and other Changelog podcasts
1:41:50 Breakmaster Cylinder and the music of The Changelog
1:50:52 How the lightning-fast Changelog website was written in Elixir
1:58:32 Open source contributors to changelog.com and key show hosts
2:11:42 Adam and Jerod on the open source conference scene
2:22:09 The next decade of The Changelog
2:29:16 Closing out The Changelog interview
===|The Changelog interviews freeCodeCamp|===
2:31:49 The 3 pillars of freeCodeCamp
2:37:50 Lessons Quincy has learned over the past 5 years
2:43:10 Getting to scale and millions of monthly users
2:50:19 The growing job market for developers and how to get a job
3:00:05 How freeCodeCamp survives and intro to the team
3:04:42 The freeCodeCamp international community
3:09:40 freeCodeCamp's curriculum and expanding it
3:17:45 freeCodeCamp's infrastructure and the JAM Stack
3:22:57 The freeCodeCamp publication and explanatory tech journalism
3:29:34 How freeCodeCamp escaped the "content platform" trap
3:31:28 freeCodeCamp's budget and the laser focus on efficiency
3:39:30 Why 100% of the donations go toward programs and 0% go toward fundraising
3:44:00 Why Quincy turned down all offers to acquire freeCodeCamp
3:46:05 Chapter - freeCodeCamp's open source Meetup.com alternative
3:55:25 The future of freeCodeCamp

Remember to check out changelog.com and subscribe to their master feed in your podcast app: https://changelog.com/master

Here's their 10th anniversary website: changelog.com/ten

topLevelComment.author: David B.E.
topLevelComment.text: Quincy, you've got such a humble spirit! God bless you for all your work!

topLevelComment.author: net brainer
topLevelComment.text: I learnt to code from free code camp be blessed

topLevelComment.author: Mr. Commentator
topLevelComment.text: freecodecamp deserves more subscribers/learners than PewDiePie and T-Series combined.

topLevelComment.author: Luke RO
topLevelComment.text: Free code camp is helping me the most right now in learning.

topLevelComment.author: H9zard_
topLevelComment.text: In my opinion free code camp is literally the best free learning platform out there, there is so much content and all of it is available for free without ads like seriously, this is amazing thank you!

topLevelComment.author: Ahhd Ab
topLevelComment.text: Hello i ,really want to learn AI and work in the same domain and I do not were I start ( AI ) . Is there any advice

topLevelComment.author: Arslan Arshad
topLevelComment.text: very informative videos

topLevelComment.author: Ebenezer Mamabolo
topLevelComment.text: Will you guys be creating any IONIC 4 tutorials soon?

topLevelComment.author: Kusal Thiwanka
topLevelComment.text: I learn tons of new things through this channel. Thank lot man.

topLevelComment.author: Code fun
topLevelComment.text: Cool!

topLevelComment.author: Sand Hill Road
topLevelComment.text: I've been a big fan of The Changelog for quite a while, super excited about this episode!

replies.author: Adam Stacoviak
replies.text: Awesome to hear! Thanks for being a fan...what did you learn about us that you'd like to hear more about?

topLevelComment.author: Kerry Weston
topLevelComment.text: Thank you for being so generous with your amazing content.

topLevelComment.author: Khushboo Kumari
topLevelComment.text: Thanks man for your beautiful creation

topLevelComment.author: balaji sharath kumar
topLevelComment.text: please make an operating system development programing using all high level languages

topLevelComment.author: skeeterburke
topLevelComment.text: With all your coding skills, why don't you just make an automatic swing pusher that senses low swing amplitude? Theres probably some code on github already ... make it say "weee!" When it pushes

topLevelComment.author: venka t
topLevelComment.text: Any plans abt TCL scripting bootcamp

topLevelComment.author: Faiz Elahi
topLevelComment.text: 34:40 adam gets into podcasting

topLevelComment.author: JAVAAID - Coding Interview Preparation
topLevelComment.text: *Awesome*
